intro: Stroganowia saravschanica, commonly known as the Kashmir carnation, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its showy, pink or white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Stroganowia saravschanica is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in temperate climates.
